radiographic_examinations.findings: Mild dependent atelectasis in the bilateral lower lobes is improved. Trace bilateral dependent pleural effusions are smaller. There is interval placement of a right anterolateral approach percutaneous pigtail drain at the site of previously seen fluid, which is reduced in volume. There is a multi-lobulated, rim-enhancing fluid collection spanning the right hemipelvis with various measurements. Small volume abdominopelvic ascites is improved. No evidence of significant lesions, hydronephrosis, or lymphadenopathy.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: There has been improvement in atelectasis and pleural effusions, reduction in volume of previously seen fluid, and improvement of small volume abdominopelvic ascites.
